Level 3: Sampling Distribution of a Sample Mean

The sampling distribution of any statistic will be normal or nearly normal if the sample size is large enough.

The null hypothesis is that the sample and population parameters are equal. The alternative hypothesis says there is a difference.
The P value or calculated probability is the estimated probability of rejecting the null hypothesis (H0) of a study question when that hypothesis is true.
